001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Argument;
007import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Expression;
008import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.mXparser;
009
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
013
014/**
015 * A discrete mathematical function defined by a univariate expression.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface represents a discrete function that can be evaluated at
019 * integer time points. The function is defined by a univariate mathematical
020 * expression provided as a string, where the variable `t` represents time. The
021 * expression is parsed and evaluated using the mXparser library.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * Downstream uses include any context where a time‑dependent function is
025 * needed, such as in‑host models or demographic adjustments. Implementations
026 * are commonly generated by Immutables (see {@link ImmutableDiscreteFunction}).
027 *
028 * @author Rob Challen
029 */
030@Value.Immutable
031@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableDiscreteFunction.class)
032@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableDiscreteFunction.class)
033public interface DiscreteFunction extends Serializable, KernelFunction {
034
035        /**
036         * A univariate mathematical function as a String containing `t` as the
037         * parameter. Supported expressions are described here:
038         * https://mathparser.org/mxparser-math-collection
039         *
040         * @return the function expression.
041         */
042        String getFTExpression();
043
044        /**
045         * The parsed expression is derived from the function expression and the time
046         * argument. It is not intended to be set directly and is ignored during JSON
047         * serialization.
048         *
049         * @return the parsed expression derived from the function expression and the
050         *         time argument.
051         */
052        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
053        default Expression getParsed() {
054                mXparser.disableUlpRounding();
055                mXparser.disableCanonicalRounding();
056                mXparser.disableAlmostIntRounding();
057                var t = this.getTimeArgument();
058                return new Expression(this.getFTExpression(), t);
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * The following methods are derived from the function expression and are not
063         * intended to be set directly. They are ignored during JSON serialization.
064         *
065         * @return the time argument and the parsed expression derived from the
066         *         function expression.
067         */
068        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
069        default Argument getTimeArgument() { return new Argument("t"); }
070
071        /**
072         * Evaluate the function at a given integer time `t`. This method sets the
073         * value of the time argument and then calculates the result using the parsed
074         * expression.
075         *
076         * @param t the time at which to evaluate the function.
077         * @return the result of evaluating the function at time `t`.
078         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the function expression is invalid or
079         *                                  if evaluation fails.
080         * @see #getFTExpression()
081         *
082         */
083        @Override
084        default double rawValue(int t) {
085                var xArg = this.getTimeArgument();
086                xArg.setArgumentValue(t);
087                var result = this.getParsed().calculate();
088                return result;
089        }
090
091}
